page.title: 13BISHOP BARRINGTON COMP. SCH.
page.content: The Bishop Barrington was one of the higher clergy in the Georgian Period. He was a personal friend of GeorgeIII. He came to Durham in 1791 as Bishop, one of the richest appointments in England. The original Barrington School was built in 1810 on a site known as Pollard's Hall on the South side of the Market Place where it remained until July 1974. At its foundation Children were admitted from the age of four or five until they could read and write. The hours were 8am to 5pm in Winter, 8am to 7pm in Summer and Masters were paid Â£120 a year. The present comprehensive school was formed from the amalgamation of Vinovium Secondary School, at Etherley Dene, and Woodhouse Close Secondary School. Now further 'rationalisation' is anticipated due to falling rolls.
